edu.nyu.cs.connectfour.game.subject

Interface GameResultSubject

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameRecord

    public interface GameResultSubject
    Author:
    shenli

    This class represents an GameResultSubject object, or "data" in the model-view paradigm. It can be sub-classed to represent an object that the application wants to have observed.

    An GameResultSubject object can have one or more GameResultObserver. An observer may be any object that implements interface GameResultObserver. After an GameResultSubject instance changes, an application calling the GameResultSubject's notifyGameResultObservers method causes all of its observers to be notified of the change by a call to their updateGameResult method.

    The order in which notifications will be delivered is unspecified. The default implementation provided in the GameResultSubject class will notify GameResultObserver in the order in which they registered interest, but subclasses may change this order, use no guaranteed order, deliver notifications on separate threads, or may guarantee that their subclass follows this order, as they choose.

    Note that this notification mechanism is has nothing to do with threads and is completely separate from the wait and notify mechanism of class Object.

    When an GameResultSubject object is newly created, its set of observers is empty.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void notifyGameResultObservers(String text)
      If this object has changed, then notify all of its observers.
      void registerGameResultObserver(GameResultObserver o)
      Adds an observer to the set of observers for this object.
      void removeGameResultObserver(GameResultObserver o)
      Deletes an observer from the set of observers of this object.

    • Method Detail

      • registerGameResultObserver

        void registerGameResultObserver(GameResultObserver o)
        Adds an observer to the set of observers for this object. The order in which notifications will be delivered to multiple observers is not specified.

        Parameters:
        o - an observer to be added

      • removeGameResultObserver

        void removeGameResultObserver(GameResultObserver o)
        Deletes an observer from the set of observers of this object. Passing null to this method will have no effect.

        Parameters:
        o - the observer to be deleted.

      • notifyGameResultObservers

        void notifyGameResultObservers(String text)
        If this object has changed, then notify all of its observers.

        Parameters:
        text - the text
